lead_paragraph: The Rev. D. Alexandra Dyer, executive director of the Healing Arts Initiative in Queens, was severely burned when someone tossed drain cleaner at her. A co-worker was among three people arrested.

headline.print_headline: Lye Attack Used to Hide  Embezzling, Officials Say
headline.main: Nonprofit Executive Attacked With Drain Cleaner in Embezzlement Cover-Up, Officials Say

snippet: The Rev. D. Alexandra Dyer, executive director of the Healing Arts Initiative in Queens, was severely burned when someone tossed drain cleaner at her. A co-worker was among three people arrested.
abstract: Authorities arrest three people in 65-count indictment related to August assault on Rev D Alexandra Dyer, executive director of nonprofit Dyer's Healing Arts Initiative in Queens; organization's former bookkeeper Kim Williams is charged with leading embezzlement scheme that netted more than $750,000 and authorities say assault on Dyer, which left her with serious burns, was attempt to cover up crime.
